meanings.definition: Able to be gleaned or gathered.
meanings.sent1: The information was gleanable from the report.
meanings.sent2: The ripe apples hanging low were easily gleanable.
meanings.sent3: It was a gleanable fact that the cat loved to chase mice.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a gleanable treasure, bright and precious.
meanings.sent5: The secret code was as gleanable as the sun in the sky.

meanings.definition: Capable of being obtained or acquired through careful examination or investigation.
meanings.sent1: The truth was gleanable through thorough research.
meanings.sent2: The solution to the puzzle was not immediately gleanable.
meanings.sent3: It was a gleanable mystery why the dog always barked at the mailman.
meanings.sent4: His intentions were as gleanable as footprints in fresh snow.
meanings.sent5: The hidden message in the painting was as gleanable as a neon sign.
